data.title: Silver’s Travel Center Hits the Mark with a Re
data.meta_description: When Silver’s Travel Center rebranded its c-store location by franchising with On The Run by Circle K, it brought a new atmosphere to the store and led to a 15 percent increase in sales.
data.meta_site_name: NATSO - Represents the truckstop and travel center industry, advancing the success of truckstop and travel centers through education and public policy advocacy.
data.text:
Editor’s note: Darren Schulte, NATSO vice president of membership, frequently visits NATSO members to review their locations and offers impactful merchandising and operations improvements. Contact Schulte at dschulte@natso.com or (915) 526-5820 to learn more about the costs and details of this service.

When Silver’s Travel Center rebranded its c-store location by franchising with On The Run by Circle K, it brought a new atmosphere to the store and led to a 15 percent increase in sales.

As part of the rebranding, the location underwent architectural changes and repositioned the point-of-sale. The store has a more open feel now that makes shoppers notice products more than they have in the past.

Silver’s offers a variety of hot foods and cold foods, all single serve. The location has also placed different grab-and-go items around the counter because that appeals to a different customer base.

Their grab-and-go food program is supported by a robust coffee, iced tea and fountain program.

Ron Hicks, General Manager of Silver’s Travel Center, Henderson Travel Center and Frog City Travel Plaza, said the remodel hasn’t taken away sales in other areas of the location and has created a boost in local traffic.

I noticed during my visit that all of the employees and customers seem happier since the remodel. The changes have added so much to the overall atmosphere of the store, adding to its overall success.

You can read more about Silver’s Travel Center in the November/December 2016 NATSO Stop Watch Magazine.
